item.title: All Secret Piano Easter Egg Songs in Deltarune Chapter 4
item.description:
There are a lot of pianos in Deltarune Chapter 4, from small-time puzzle pianos to a grand golden organ required to access the chapter's secret boss. While you have to track down the correct note combinations for each of these pianos to progress through the main story of Deltarune Chapter 4, you can actually play some classic Undertale songs to get some unique dialog from Ralsei and Susie.

You can only play these songs at a specific piano in Deltarune Chapter 4. It's the big blue organ that opens the way to the Dark Fountain in the Old Man's study. You can play any combination of notes on this instrument, and there's even a button to shift the octave so you can create a wider range of melodies. There are quite a few easter egg songs you can play on this piano, and each one gets a great reaction from the party.

Deltarune Chapter 4 Piano Easter Egg Songs

In addition to the sheet music required to continue, these are all the secret songs you can play on the piano in Deltarune Chapter 4.

The table below uses compass notation, so the directions match the in-game arrows. Octave shifts are denoted with a $ before the note.

Song

Notes

His Theme

$SW-E-O-$SW-$NW-$NW-O-$SW-O-$SW-$NW-$NW-O

Your Best Friend

SE-SE-S-SW-SE-S-S-SW-E-$SW

Annoying Dog

O-S-SW-W-S-S-SE-S-E-O-S-SW-S-SE-S-S

The Legend

$W-O-SE-N-NW-SW-E-SE

Don't Forget

SE-S-SW-SW-SW-SW-SW-O-SE-E-E-E-E-E-SE-E-O-O-O-O-O-NW-N-NW-SW-SE

Lost Girl

$S-$W-$N-SE-NW-N-SW-SE-W-$NW-$N-SW-$NW-$N

Spear of Justice

SW-S-E-SE-O-E

Rouxls Kaard

SE-O-$NW-$W-$W-W-SW-S-SE-E-O-E-SE

Heartache

$W-$N-$NW-$N-$W-$W-$NW-$N-SW-SE

Dark Sanctuary

$W-O-SW-E-O-E-O-E-SW-E-O-E

Megalovania

$W-$W-W-SE

You've Got a Friend in Me

SE-SW-SE-W-SW-O-W-N-W-N-SW

Chopsticks

S-S-S-S-S-S-S-S-SE-SE-SE-SE-SE-SE-SE-SE-NW-NW-NW-NW-NW-W-NW-N-N-N-N-NW-W

Heart and Soul

$N-$N-$N-$N-$NW-$W-$NW-$N-E-SE-SE-SE-SE-E-O-E-SE-S

Once Upon a Time

$SW-SW-E-O-SW-$SW

Most of these just result in little dialogue quips from either Susie or Ralsei, but you really should try playing Megalovania at least once. There's a special interaction for it. You won't get any items or equipment for playing these songs, though, so feel free to move on once you've had your fill.

There are plenty more secrets to discover in Deltarune Chapter 4, and even though it may seem like you're nearing the end of the chapter by the time you reach the big piano, there's still a lot of stuff to do before the credits finally roll. Before moving onto the Dark Fountain, you should also take the time to fight Chapter 4's secret boss if you're up for a challenge.

item.title: Lies of P: Overture is Proof One Soulslike Tradition Needs to Die
item.description:
The following contains major spoilers for the end of Lies of P ​​​​​​.

The book of Lies of P may be closed now after Lies of P: Overture definitively tied a bow on its story. Surely there’s more that Neowiz could produce for that specific fairy tale as an adaptation of Adventures of Pinocchio if it wanted, and it’s unclear whether its teased Wizard of Oz sequel will stick to Lies of P ’s dwellings or not, as Dorothy was shown near Hotel Krat. However, Lies of P: Overture itself is a phenomenal expansion of the base game’s story with a sizable prequel chapter that reinforces and elaborates on beats and lore that Lies of P only scratched the surface of.

Lies of P: Overture is a safe bet for a DLC as it whisks P and Gemini to the past with only a marginal few alterations to the canon timeline awaiting them in the present day upon completion. It takes quite a while to see the fruits of the DLC adventure, though, due to Lies of P: Overture being roughly 15–20 hours long. Moreover, the lengths players must go to in order to access the DLC are arguably egregious, even if it was FromSoftware’s seminal Soulslike work that had inspired Neowiz to make it incredibly difficult to reach.

Lies of P: Overture’s DLC is Not Easy to Access from a New Playthrough

I was fortunate enough in my playthrough of the DLC that I had recently finished a NG playthrough and hadn’t proceeded to a NG+ playthrough yet. This was by design—I knew I didn’t want to go in on a NG+ playthrough, understanding how difficult FromSoftware Soulslike DLCs can be when considering that difficulty scales with multiple NG+ playthroughs, and that I’d have the most enjoyable time if I went in with a P who was as overpowered as possible by the time I went into Lies of P: Overture .

Like most other players, I also correctly presumed where Lies of P: Overture ’s DLC entry point would be, at the broken stargazer near Chapter 5’s Path of the Pilgrim stargazer. Fortunately, without knowing that I’d also have to meet the prerequisite of repairing the Hotel Krat stargazer in Chapter 9, I was gifted the necessary quest item automatically since I had already progressed through all the base game story content. But anyone who had endeavored through a NG or NG+ playthrough and had stopped at Chapter 5 won’t have access to the DLC until nearly the end of Chapter 9.

Lies of P: Overture is Hopefully the Last Time Soulslikes DLCs are Held at Bay

Lies of P is a linear action-RPG Soulslike and reaching Chapter 9 doesn’t take nearly as long as it does to reach Mohgwyn’s Palace in Elden Ring , with the latter also being far more convoluted to locate on one’s own. Indeed, Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree is quite brutal regarding its potential for casual replayability due to the demands that must be met in order to access it, and the same can be said for nearly all of FromSoftware’s Soulslike DLCs.

It’s one thing if DLCs or expansions are tremendously challenging and encourage players to come back when they’ve obtained more levels, gear, or weapons, but to also withhold DLCs until players are already deep within the base game is another.

Anyone who had endeavored through a NG or NG+ playthrough and had stopped at Chapter 5 won’t have access to the DLC until nearly the end of Chapter 9.

To be fair, Lies of P: Overture ’s bosses and characters only make sense from the perspective players have of what they’ve experienced in the base game thus far, and players would undoubtedly be bewildered, much less riddled with spoilers, if they could access it instantly before receiving context in the base game’s story. Still, the argument stands that future Soulslike DLCs should quit their tradition of being accessed so late. If nothing else, replayability takes a massive hit in these cases, at least for anyone who doesn’t have the time to spend wading through arduous challenges and upwards of 20–30 hours of content.

6 Images
6 Images

Lies of P: Overture is a dramatic prequel to the acclaimed Lies of P, transporting you to the city of Krat in its final days of haunting late-19th-century Belle Époque beauty. On the brink of the Puppet Frenzy massacre, you follow the legendary Stalker—a mysterious guide—through untold stories and chilling secrets. As Geppetto’s deadly puppet, you’ll journey through Krat and its surroundings, uncover hidden backstories, and face epic battles that shape the past and future of Lies of P.

item.title: Pokemon Fan Art Imagines Hoenn Starters With Their Types Swapped
item.description:
The beloved starter trio from the Gen 3 Pokemon games has gotten a bit of a shake-up thanks to some popular fan artwork that reimagines their designs if they swapped types. Even decades after their introductions, the plethora of starter Pokemon from throughout the Pokemon series' history remain popular subjects of fan-made artwork, with some creative fans merging different creature designs and others even imagining what some critters could look like in a warped alternate universe.

Fan art has been a massively popular thing among the Pokemon community as a whole since as far back as the franchise's inception in the 90s, and it remains the most popular method for fans to express their love for their favorite creatures as well as the series as a whole. No shortage of fan artwork also helps make clear just how timeless many Pokemon really are. While some of the more recently introduced starters from modern Pokemon titles may not be quite as iconic, a lot of the starter Pokemon from the series' earlier generations don't seem to have diminished in popularity over the years, with artists never failing to discover new ways of redesigning them.

Such designs tend to garner a ton of appreciation from fans of the franchise, and for good reason. A fantastic batch of artwork recently shared by the artist known as kaltzer freshens up the designs of the Hoenn starters and their evolutions by switching up the types they use, and the resulting designs look just like what fans might have expected to see from some of Pokemon 's older games. These alternate-universe creature designs represent Treecko and its evolutions as Water-type Pokemon, the Torchic line as Grass-type, and the Mudkip family as Fire-type instead. Plenty of other Pokemon fan artwork has taken a similar approach, with some artists redesigning their favorite starters around some unexpected types.

Hoenn Starters and Their Evolutions With Types Swapped

When it comes to official variations of existing Pokemon, some of the more recent installments of the Pokemon game series have proven that even the most unbelievable creature designs could potentially come to life in the games in one way or another. Gen 9's Paradox Pokemon are a great example of how existing Pokemon can get a pretty extreme makeover. These rare and very unusual types of Pokemon quite literally hail from different timelines according to in-game lore, which explains how Pokemon Scarlet and Violet 's Paradox Pokemon represent familiar Pokemon that appear to have come from a different time period altogether.

There are also regional variant Pokemon, genetic offshoots of existing Pokemon that are different in appearance and capabilities thanks to the unique environments they live in. Fans are hoping to see a ton of new Pokemon like this in the upcoming Pokemon Legends: Z-A , the next major title in the series that's set to release later this year on October 16.

item.title: Dune: Awakening - Best Stillsuits & How To Get Them
item.description:
Summary

  • The best Stillsuits in Dune: Awakening vary in armor, heat protection, and ingredient requirements.
  • Advantages of stillsuits: water supply, element protection, with downsides of vulnerability and resource demands.
  • Higher-tier stillsuits like CHOAM and Batigh offer better protection but require advanced materials.

Every MMORPG has a variety of weapons and gear to fit every unique character build. The lore of Dune includes the legendary Fremen stillsuits, and in Dune: Awakening , there's a whole line of stillsuits available, varying in durability, quality, and capacity.

The major advantages of a Stillsuit in Dune: Awakening are the constant supply of water and better protection from the elements, but the downside is more vulnerability to enemy attacks. The best stillsuits are available later in the game, but some choices are ideal for the low and mid-level grind.

7 Scavenger Stillsuit

Early Survivalist Gear

  • Armor Value: 6
  • Heat Protection: 0.03
  • Catchpocket Size: 500

This is the first Stillsuit that most players research and make because it's the subject of a quest called "Echoes of the Past." It's part of the Tutorial quest chain in which players learn the value of the moisture-sealed caves, how to access them, and the resources found within.

The Scavenger Stillsuit is made of plant fiber, which can be found in various locations throughout the open world, and Micro-sandwich Fabric. This material spawns randomly in chests that players find in various locations, like bandit camps, but it is always part of the entrance that must be cut away to access a moisture-sealed cave. A General Fabricator is sufficient to make one, but more advanced players can use their Clothing Fabricator.

6 Kirab Stillsuit

Uses More Durable Iron

  • Armor Value: 10
  • Heat Protection: 0.05
  • Catchpocket Size: 500

The Kirab are part of the smuggler, slaver, and bandit population on Arrakis, and they've improved on the design of previous stillsuits. Once the player has progressed far enough in the Research tab to iron products, they can use a few Intel points to discover the Kirab Stillsuit .

In addition to plant fiber and Micro-sandwich Fabric, this product requires iron bars as part of the recipe. These can be easily farmed in the Vermillius Gap, which is where the player will be spending most of their time when they unlock this recipe.

5 Slaver Stillsuit

Requires A Garment Fabricator

  • Armor Value: 15
  • Heat Protection: 0.06
  • Catchpocket Size: 500

As the Stillsuits improve, components to make them also become more difficult to find and much more valuable. Not only do players need special materials like steel ingots and Silicone Blocks, but they also need a Garment Fabricator, since all advanced pieces of gear require a more high-tech crafting and assembly process.

Steel ingots require carbon, iron, and water along with an Ore Refinery. Silicone blocks are made in a Chemical Refinery from Flour Sand, which is found in bandit camps and scavenger outposts. The only other material that's needed is the Micro-sandwich fabric, a common resource needed for virtually all clothing recipes.

4 Native Stillsuit

The Fremen Way

  • Armor Value: 23
  • Heat Protection: 0.9
  • Catchpocket Size: 500

There's no stillsuit in the game that's specifically called "the Fremen Stillsuit," and the lore of the environment states that the Fremen are either hidden or extinct, but the Native Stillsuit design is the next best thing. It's slightly better than the Slaver version and requires one additional ingredient, Stillsuit Tubing, and instead of steel, the metal used is aluminum.

Aluminum is more difficult to find and is located further north, but by now, players will have bikes, buggies, and 'thopters that can reach these locations. The only other stillsuit that also uses aluminum is Shadrath's, but this is a unique schematic that can only be purchased in Sentinel City from a vendor for a very high price.

3 Mercenary Stillsuit

Designed For A Soldier

  • Armor Value: 35
  • Heat Protection: 1.2
  • Catchpocket Size: 500

The heat protection isn't much better than other models, but the armor value for this stillsuit is higher than average, perhaps because it was made for a covert type of soldier. Aside from the sandmasters and dunerunners, there are plenty of hired guns on Arrakis, and they have to strike a balance between battle-readiness and survival capability.

Uraluminum ingots, the main ingredient in this more advanced suit, are refined from aluminum ingots and Jasmium Crystals in a medium refinery. The crafting ability and hardware needed to make this a mid- to high-level item are intended for characters at a higher level.

2 CHOAM Stillsuit

Precious Plastanium

  • Armor Value: 45
  • Heat Protection: 1.5
  • Catchpocket Size: 500

The CHOAM stillsuit has a better armor rating and is stronger against the elements than the Mercenary version. It uses a higher-level material called plastanium, which is made by refining titanium ore with stravidium fiber in a large ore refinery. Players who are making this stillsuit will have access to the most advanced fabricators and will be preparing for endgame content, and some of these resources can only be found in dangerous, high-level regions like the Deep Desert.

The CHOAM corporation would be expected to have a high-quality suit to protect its employees on the ground, so it's not a surprise that one of the best stillsuits in Dune: Awakening would be of their design. It might be possible to buy a suit on the Exchange, but this would cost the equivalent of getting the materials anyway.

1 Batigh Stillsuit

A Unique Schematic

  • Armor Value: 184
  • Heat Protection: 1.2
  • Catchpocket Size: 500

Another great reason to unlock the Planetologist skill tree is that the schematic for one of Dune: Awakening 's best stillsuits is the reward for completing the entire questline. According to the greater storyline, Dr. Kynes helped to design this suit personally and was a former colleague of Derek Chinara, the Planetologist trainer who is the keeper of the schematic that teaches the pattern.

When players completes "The Final Piece," which is the last in the long and complicated Planetologist training questline, they'll be rewarded with the schematic for the Batigh Stillsuit . It's made of several complex materials that are only available in the endgame, such as Duraluminum Ingots and Spice-infused Duraluminum Dust​​​​​​.

item.title: July 2025 Will Kick Off a New Era for Blox Fruits
item.description:
Fans of Gamer Robot’s Blox Fruits will see more frequent updates to the Roblox RPG. Blox Fruits is one of the more popular games found within Roblox , with an active player count of around 200,000 and over 50 billion visits to date.

With such a large following, the developers at Gamer Robot have been looking at ways of improving the One Piece -inspired RPG. In 2024, Blox Fruits implemented dedicated servers for players. This move was especially helpful for new gamers looking to explore the large world without having to deal with large crowds. Now, Gamer Robot has set its sights on improving the player experience by introducing more frequent updates to the Roblox -hosted RPG.

Starting in July 2025 with the Summer Expansion, Blox Fruits will see weekly updates rolled out to gamers. According to a recent Blox Bulletin, hese updates will bring several fruit reworks, brand-new gameplay mechanics, and several features fans have been calling for. A limited-time event will be held to celebrate Blox Fruit ’s 50 billion visits milestone. This event is set to offer players the chance to earn exclusive items, as well as laying the groundwork for future updates.

Blox Fruits Set to Get Weekly Updates Starting in July 2025

Gamer Robot hopes this new format of delivering content updates will help provide a consistent experience for players. Before this announcement, the developers supported players with sporadic content updates and limited-time codes. Gamers can still redeem a wealth of codes for Blox Fruits that unlock different benefits. The current list of bonuses includes 20 minutes of 2x experience, stat resets, and in-game titles.

As players wait to see the implementation of weekly updates, there is still a world of games to explore in Roblox . For example, Grow a Garden has reached a record active player count in Roblox just a few months after its release. The new farming simulator has clocked a whopping 3 million active users since it was released in March 2025. With such large numbers trying to access the game, some players reported Roblox completely crashing under the strain.

Despite being a few years older, Blox Fruits remains a popular example of RPGs found within Roblox . The regular updates to the summer expansion will no doubt be welcome news for fans as they look to explore the high seas and open world. With the promise of more content to come, it seems that gamers will have more to look forward to in Blox Fruits .
